Title: Japan Tsunami What happened?
Year: 2011
Genre: Documentary
Language: English Ac3, Ac3 Spanish
Subtitles: Spanish forced

CAST: 
----- 
On Friday March 11, 2011, an earthquake of magnitude 9.0 on the Richter scale triggered a tsunami that devastated parts of the coast of Japan. 

Tsunami in Japan: how it was investigated the science behind the earthquake and tsunami program is Professor Roger Bilham of Geological Sciences - which came to Japan days after the quake - which starts to see the devastation caused by the air .. 

The earthquake shook Japan 12 feet closer to the U.S. The land was knocked off its axis and the speed of rotation of the Earth has changed This was one of the largest earthquakes ever measured, .. The soil along the eastern side of Japan fell nearly 10 feet, making the catastrophic tsunami. 

The film is also known journalist Callum Macrae as it travels north, where the cities of Sendai and Ofunato used to be vibrant fishing villages. Here we see the destruction first hand and meet the locals struggling to cope with the consequences. 

Japan is in the Ring of Fire where the Pacific plate meet the earth. The ocean floor dives beneath the volcanic chain of islands that make up Japan. And when the tension builds between two plates of the energy is released as a massive earthquake. 

The program provides science and analysis to explain why this happened, where it did, and why it was so devastating to listen to scientists at the Tsunami Warning Center in Hawaii Pacific, which traced the deadly wave that moved the Pacific, and scientists research center Tsunami Oregon who studies the dynamics of earthquakes generate tsunamis. 

As Japan is living with the consequences of this terrible force of nature, the film reveals how the country has changed forever.
